p: So, resources can be allocated to high-risk areas. Availability of fast, reliable point of care testing capability would be able to identify and avoid transmission of this virus even by asymptomatic carriers. For example, currently, all routine surgical procedures are postponed across the US healthcare systems. However, the availability of such testing capacity may be implemented to screen the patients and surgical team preoperative to ascertain their infection status and go ahead with even routine surgical procedures, which make the bulk of the revenues for hospitals and it is extremely important for the sustainability of any healthcare system.
